revised_title: Effects of Incombustible Vapours on the Limits of Inflammability of Gases and Vapours in Air
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the influence of incombustible vapours on the limits of inflammability of gases and vapours in air. They found that the presence of incombustible gases, such as methyl bromide, narrows and ultimately extinguishes the limits of flammability of combustible gases in air. This research has implications for fire safety and the development of fire extinguishing techniques.
